067
068/**
069 * Entry point for Juneau microservice that implements a REST interface using Jetty on a single port.
070 *
071 * <h5 class='topic'>Jetty Server Details</h5>
072 *
073 * The Jetty server is created by the {@link #createServer()} method and started with the {@link #startServer()} method.
074 * These methods can be overridden to provided customized behavior.
075 *
076 * <h5 class='topic'>Defining REST Resources</h5>
077 *
078 * Top-level REST resources are defined in the <c>jetty.xml</c> file as normal servlets.
079 *
080 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
081 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-microservice-jetty">juneau-microservice-jetty</a>
082 * </ul>
083 */
084public class JettyMicroservice extends Microservice {
085
086   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
087   // Static
088   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
089
090   private static final String KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER = "ServletContextHandler";
091
092    private static volatile JettyMicroservice INSTANCE;
093
094   private static void setInstance(JettyMicroservice m) {
095      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
096         INSTANCE = m;
097      }
098   }
099
100   /**
101    * Returns the Microservice instance.
102    * <p>
103    * This method only works if there's only one Microservice instance in a JVM.
104    * Otherwise, it's just overwritten by the last instantiated microservice.
105    *
106    * @return The Microservice instance, or <jk>null</jk> if there isn't one.
107    */
108   public static JettyMicroservice getInstance() {
109      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
110         return INSTANCE;
111      }
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Entry-point method.
116    *
117    * @param args Command line arguments.
118    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
119    */
120   public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
121      JettyMicroservice
122         .create()
123         .args(args)
124         .build()
125         .start()
126         .startConsole()
127         .join();
128   }
129
130   /**
131    * Creates a new microservice builder.
132    *
133    * @return A new microservice builder.
134    */
135   public static Builder create() {
136      return new Builder();
137   }
138
139   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140   // Builder
141   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
142
143   /**
144    * Builder class.
145    */
146   public static class Builder extends Microservice.Builder {
147
148      String jettyXml;
149      int[] ports;
150      Boolean jettyXmlResolveVars;
151      Map<String,Servlet> servlets = map();
152      Map<String,Object> servletAttributes = map();
153      JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
154      JettyServerFactory factory;
155
156      /**
157       * Constructor.
158       */
159      protected Builder() {}
160
161      /**
162       * Copy constructor.
163       *
164       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy settings from.
165       */
166      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
167         super(copyFrom);
168         this.jettyXml = copyFrom.jettyXml;
169         this.ports = copyFrom.ports;
170         this.jettyXmlResolveVars = copyFrom.jettyXmlResolveVars;
171         this.servlets = copyOf(copyFrom.servlets);
172         this.servletAttributes = copyOf(copyFrom.servletAttributes);
173         this.listener = copyFrom.listener;
174      }
175
176      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
177      public Builder copy() {
178         return new Builder(this);
179      }
180
181        /**
182         * Specifies the contents or location of the <c>jetty.xml</c> file used by the Jetty server.
183         *
184         * <p>
185         * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
186         * <ul class='spaced-list'>
187         *   <li>
188         *         <c>Jetty/config</c> setting in the config file.
189         *         <c>Jetty-Config</c> setting in the manifest file.
190         * </ul>
191         *
192         * <p>
193         * By default, we look for the <c>jetty.xml</c> file in the following locations:
194         * <ul class='spaced-list'>
195         *     <li><c>jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
196         *     <li><c>files/jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
197         *     <li><c>/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
198         *     <li><c>/files/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
199         * </ul>
200         *
201         * @param jettyXml
202         *     The contents or location of the file.
203         *     <br>Can be any of the following:
204         *     <ul>
205         *      <li>{@link String} - Relative path to file on file system or classpath.
206         *      <li>{@link File} - File on file system.
207         *      <li>{@link Path} - Path on file system.
208         *      <li>{@link InputStream} - Raw contents as <c>UTF-8</c> encoded stream.
209         *      <li>{@link Reader} - Raw contents.
210         *     </ul>
211         *
212         * @param resolveVars
213         *     If <jk>true</jk>, SVL variables in the file will automatically be resolved.
214         * @return This object.
215         * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
216         */
217        public Builder jettyXml(Object jettyXml, boolean resolveVars) throws IOException {
218            if (jettyXml instanceof String)
219                this.jettyXml = read(resolveFile(jettyXml.toString()));
220            else if (jettyXml instanceof File file)
221                this.jettyXml = read(file);
222            else if (jettyXml instanceof Path path)
223                this.jettyXml = read(path);
224            else if (jettyXml instanceof InputStream inputStream)
225                this.jettyXml = read(inputStream);
226            else if (jettyXml instanceof Reader reader)
227                this.jettyXml = read(reader);
228            else
229                throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid object type passed to jettyXml(Object): {0}", className(jettyXml));
230            this.jettyXmlResolveVars = resolveVars;
231            return this;
232        }
233
234      /**
235       * Specifies the ports to use for the web server.
236       *
237       * <p>
238       * You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  <js>'0'</js> indicates to try a random port.
239       * The resulting available port gets set as the system property <js>"availablePort"</js> which can be referenced in the
240       * <c>jetty.xml</c> file as <js>"$S{availablePort}"</js> (assuming resolveVars is enabled).
241       *
242       * <p>
243       * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
244       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
245       *    <li>
246       *       <c>Jetty/port</c> setting in the config file.
247       *    <li>
248       *       <c>Jetty-Port</c> setting in the manifest file.
249       *    <li>
250       *       <c>8000</c>
251       * </ul>
252       *
253       * Jetty/port", mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}
254       * @param ports The ports to use for the web server.
255       * @return This object.
256       */
257      public Builder ports(int...ports) {
258         this.ports = ports;
259         return this;
260      }
261
262      /**
263       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
264       *
265       * <p>
266       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
267       * <br>The path is pulled from the {@link Rest#path()} annotation.
268       *
269       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
270       * @return This object.
271       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
272       */
273      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends RestServlet> c) throws ExecutableException {
274         RestServlet rs;
275         try {
276            rs = c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
277         } catch (Exception e) {
278            throw new ExecutableException(e);
279         }
280         return servlet(rs, '/' + rs.getPath());
281      }
282
283      /**
284       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
285       *
286       * <p>
287       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
288       *
289       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
290       * @param path The servlet path spec.
291       * @return This object.
292       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
293       */
294      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends Servlet> c, String path) throws ExecutableException {
295         try {
296            return servlet(c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance(), path);
297         } catch (Exception e) {
298            throw new ExecutableException(e);
299         }
300      }
301
302      /**
303       * Adds a servlet instance to the servlet container.
304       *
305       * @param servlet The servlet to add to the servlet container.
306       * @param path The servlet path spec.
307       * @return This object.
308       */
309      public Builder servlet(Servlet servlet, String path) {
310         servlets.put(path, servlet);
311         return this;
312      }
313
314      /**
315       * Adds a set of servlets to the servlet container.
316       *
317       * @param servlets
318       *    A map of servlets to add to the servlet container.
319       *    <br>Keys are path specs for the servlet.
320       * @return This object.
321       */
322      public Builder servlets(Map<String,Servlet> servlets) {
323         if (servlets != null)
324            this.servlets.putAll(servlets);
325         return this;
326      }
327
328      /**
329       * Adds a servlet attribute to the servlet container.
330       *
331       * @param name The attribute name.
332       * @param value The attribute value.
333       * @return This object.
334       */
335      public Builder servletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
336         this.servletAttributes.put(name, value);
337         return this;
338      }
339
340      /**
341       * Adds a set of servlet attributes to the servlet container.
342       *
343       * @param values The map of attributes.
344       * @return This object.
345       */
346      public Builder servletAttribute(Map<String,Object> values) {
347         if (values != null)
348            this.servletAttributes.putAll(values);
349         return this;
350      }
351
352      /**
353       * Specifies the factory to use for creating the Jetty {@link Server} instance.
354       *
355       * <p>
356       * If not specified, uses {@link BasicJettyServerFactory}.
357       *
358       * @param value The new value for this property.
359       * @return This object.
360       */
361      public Builder jettyServerFactory(JettyServerFactory value) {
362         this.factory = value;
363         return this;
364      }
365

460      /**
461       * Registers an event listener for this microservice.
462       *
463       * @param listener An event listener for this microservice.
464       * @return This object.
465       */
466      public Builder listener(JettyMicroserviceListener listener) {
467         super.listener(listener);
468         this.listener = listener;
469         return this;
470      }

472
473   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
474   // Instance
475   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
476
477   final Messages messages = Messages.of(JettyMicroservice.class);
478
479   private final Builder builder;
480   final JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
481   private final JettyServerFactory factory;
482
483   volatile Server server;
484
485   /**
486    * Constructor.
487    *
488    * @param builder The constructor arguments.
489    * @throws IOException Problem occurred reading file.
490    * @throws ParseException Malformed content found in config file.
491    */
492   protected JettyMicroservice(Builder builder) throws ParseException, IOException {
493      super(builder);
494      setInstance(this);
495      this.builder = builder.copy();
496      this.listener = builder.listener != null ? builder.listener : new BasicJettyMicroserviceListener();
497      this.factory = builder.factory != null ? builder.factory : new BasicJettyServerFactory();
498   }
499
500   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
501   // Methods implemented on Microservice API
502   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
503
504   @Override /* Microservice */
505   public synchronized JettyMicroservice init() throws ParseException, IOException {
506      super.init();
507      return this;
508   }
509
510   @Override /* Microservice */
511   public synchronized JettyMicroservice startConsole() throws Exception {
512      super.startConsole();
513      return this;
514   }
515
516   @Override /* Microservice */
517   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stopConsole() throws Exception {
518      super.stopConsole();
519      return this;
520   }
521
522   @Override /* Microservice */
523   public synchronized JettyMicroservice start() throws Exception {
524      super.start();
525      createServer();
526      startServer();
527      return this;
528   }
529
530   @Override /* Microservice */
531   public JettyMicroservice join() throws Exception {
532      server.join();
533      return this;
534   }
535
536   @Override /* Microservice */
537   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stop() throws Exception {
538      final Logger logger = getLogger();
539      final Messages mb2 = messages;
540      Thread t = new Thread("JettyMicroserviceStop") {
541         @Override /* Thread */
542         public void run() {
543            try {
544               if (server == null || server.isStopping() || server.isStopped())
545                  return;
546               listener.onStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
547               out(mb2, "StoppingServer");
548               server.stop();
549               out(mb2, "ServerStopped");
550               listener.onPostStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
551            } catch (Exception e) {
552               logger.log(Level.WARNING, e.getLocalizedMessage(), e);
553            }
554         }
555      };
556      t.start();
557      try {
558         t.join();
559      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
560         e.printStackTrace();
561      }
562      super.stop();
563
564      return this;
565   }
566
567   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
568   // JettyMicroservice API methods.
569   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
570
571   /**
572    * Returns the port that this microservice started up on.
573    * <p>
574    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/port</c> value in the
575    * Jetty configuration.
576    *
577    * @return The port that this microservice started up on.
578    */
579   public int getPort() {
580      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
581         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
582            return ((ServerConnector)c).getPort();
583      throw new IllegalStateException("Could not locate ServerConnector in Jetty server.");
584   }
585
586   /**
587    * Returns the context path that this microservice is using.
588    * <p>
589    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Handlers[ServletContextHandler]/contextPath</c> value
590    * in the Jetty configuration.
591    *
592    * @return The context path that this microservice is using.
593    */
594    public String getContextPath() {
595        return getServletContextHandler().getContextPath();
596//        for (Handler h : getServer().getHandlers()) {
597//            if (h instanceof HandlerCollection)
598//                for (org.eclipse.jetty.ee9.nested.Handler h2 : ((HandlerCollection) h).getChildHandlers())
599//                    if (h2 instanceof ServletContextHandler)
600//                        return ((ServletContextHandler) h2).getContextPath();
601//            if (h instanceof ServletContextHandler)
602//                return ((ServletContextHandler) h).getContextPath();
603//        }
604//        throw new IllegalStateException("Could not locate ServletContextHandler in Jetty server.");
605    }
606
607   /**
608    * Returns whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
609    * <p>
610    * The value is determined by looking for the existence of an SSL Connection Factorie by looking for the
611    * <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/ConnectionFactories[SslConnectionFactory]</c> value in the Jetty
612    * configuration.
613    *
614    * @return Whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
615    */
616   public String getProtocol() {
617      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
618         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
619            for (ConnectionFactory cf : ((ServerConnector)c).getConnectionFactories())
620               if (cf instanceof SslConnectionFactory)
621                  return "https";
622      return "http";
623   }
624
625   /**
626    * Returns the hostname of this microservice.
627    * <p>
628    * Simply uses <c>InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName()</c>.
629    *
630    * @return The hostname of this microservice.
631    */
632   public String getHostName() {
633      String hostname = "localhost";
634      try {
635         hostname = InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName();
636      } catch (UnknownHostException e) {}
637      return hostname;
638   }
639
640   /**
641    * Returns the URI where this microservice is listening on.
642    *
643    * @return The URI where this microservice is listening on.
644    */
645   public URI getURI() {
646      String cp = getContextPath();
647      try {
648         return new URI(getProtocol(), null, getHostName(), getPort(), "/".equals(cp) ? null : cp, null, null);
649      } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
650         throw asRuntimeException(e);
651      }
652   }
653
654   /**
655    * Method used to create (but not start) an instance of a Jetty server.
656    *
657    * <p>
658    * Subclasses can override this method to customize the Jetty server before it is started.
659    *
660    * <p>
661    * The default implementation is configured by the following values in the config file
662    * if a jetty.xml is not specified via a <c>REST/jettyXml</c> setting:
663    * <p class='bini'>
664    *    <cc>#================================================================================
665    *    # Jetty settings
666    *    #================================================================================</cc>
667    *    <cs>[Jetty]</cs>
668    *
669    *    <cc># Path of the jetty.xml file used to configure the Jetty server.</cc>
670    *    <ck>config</ck> = jetty.xml
671    *
672    *    <cc># Resolve Juneau variables in the jetty.xml file.</cc>
673    *    <ck>resolveVars</ck> = true
674    *
675    *    <cc># Port to use for the jetty server.
676    *    # You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  '0' indicates to try a random port.
677    *    # The resulting available port gets set as the system property "availablePort" which can be referenced in the
678    *    # jetty.xml file as "$S{availablePort}" (assuming resolveVars is enabled).</cc>
679    *    <ck>port</ck> = 10000,0,0,0
680    * </p>
681    *
682    * @return The newly-created server.
683    * @throws ParseException Configuration file contains malformed input.
684    * @throws IOException File could not be read.
685    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
686    */
687   public Server createServer() throws ParseException, IOException, ExecutableException {
688      listener.onCreateServer(this);
689
690      Config cf = getConfig();
691      JsonMap mf = getManifest();
692      VarResolver vr = getVarResolver();
693
694      int[] ports = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.ports, cf.get("Jetty/port").as(int[].class).orElseGet(()->mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}, int[].class)));
695      int availablePort = findOpenPort(ports);
696
697      if (System.getProperty("availablePort") == null)
698         System.setProperty("availablePort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
699
700      String jettyXml = builder.jettyXml;
701      String jettyConfig = cf.get("Jetty/config").orElse(mf.getString("Jetty-Config", "jetty.xml"));
702      boolean resolveVars = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.jettyXmlResolveVars, cf.get("Jetty/resolveVars").asBoolean().orElse(false));
703
704      if (jettyXml == null)
705         jettyXml = IOUtils.loadSystemResourceAsString("jetty.xml", ".", "files");
706      if (jettyXml == null)
707         throw new BasicRuntimeException("jetty.xml file ''{0}'' was not found on the file system or classpath.", jettyConfig);
708
709      if (resolveVars)
710         jettyXml = vr.resolve(jettyXml);
711
712      getLogger().info(jettyXml);
713
714      try {
715         server = factory.create(jettyXml);
716      } catch (Exception e2) {
717         throw new ExecutableException(e2);
718      }
719
720      for (String s : cf.get("Jetty/servlets").asStringArray().orElse(new String[0])) {
721         try {
722            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(s));
723            if (c.isChildOf(RestServlet.class)) {
724               RestServlet rs = (RestServlet)c.newInstance();
725               addServlet(rs, rs.getPath());
726            } else {
727               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servlets.  Must be a subclass of RestServlet: {0}", s);
728            }
729         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
730            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
731         }
732      }
733
734      cf.get("Jetty/servletMap").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach((k,v) -> {
735         try {
736            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(v.toString()));
737            if (c.isChildOf(Servlet.class)) {
738               Servlet rs = (Servlet)c.newInstance();
739               addServlet(rs, k);
740            } else {
741               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servletMap.  Must be a subclass of Servlet: {0}", v);
742            }
743         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
744            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
745         }
746      });
747
748      cf.get("Jetty/servletAttributes").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach(this::addServletAttribute);
749
750      builder.servlets.forEach((k,v) -> addServlet(v, k));
751
752      builder.servletAttributes.forEach(this::addServletAttribute);
753
754      if (System.getProperty("juneau.serverPort") == null)
755         System.setProperty("juneau.serverPort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
756
757      return server;
758   }
759
760   /**
761    * Calls {@link Server#destroy()} on the underlying Jetty server if it exists.
762    *
763    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
764    */
765   public void destroyServer() throws Exception {
766      if (server != null)
767         server.destroy();
768      server = null;
769   }
770
771   /**
772    * Adds an arbitrary servlet to this microservice.
773    *
774    * @param servlet The servlet instance.
775    * @param pathSpec The context path of the servlet.
776    * @return This object.
777    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
778    */
779   public JettyMicroservice addServlet(Servlet servlet, String pathSpec) {
780      ServletHolder sh = new ServletHolder(servlet);
781      if (pathSpec != null && ! pathSpec.endsWith("/*"))
782         pathSpec = trimTrailingSlashes(pathSpec) + "/*";
783      getServletContextHandler().addServlet(sh, pathSpec);
784      return this;
785   }
786
787   /**
788    * Finds and returns the servlet context handler defined in the Jetty container.
789    *
790    * @return The servlet context handler.
791    * @throws RuntimeException if context handler is not defined.
792    */
793   public ServletContextHandler getServletContextHandler() {
794      Object obj = getServer().getAttribute(KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER);
795      if (obj instanceof ServletContextHandler) {
796         return (ServletContextHandler)obj;
797      }
798      throw new IllegalStateException("Servlet context handler not found in jetty server or at attribute '" + KEY_SERVLET_CONTEXT_HANDLER + "'");
799   }
800
801   /**
802    * Adds a servlet attribute to the Jetty server.
803    *
804    * @param name The server attribute name.
805    * @param value The context path of the servlet.
806    * @return This object.
807    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
808    */
809   public JettyMicroservice addServletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
810      getServer().setAttribute(name, value);
811      return this;
812   }
813
814   /**
815    * Returns the underlying Jetty server.
816    *
817    * @return The underlying Jetty server, or <jk>null</jk> if {@link #createServer()} has not yet been called.
818    */
819   public Server getServer() {
820      return Objects.requireNonNull(server, "Server not found.  createServer() must be called first.");
821   }
822
823   /**
824    * Method used to start the Jetty server created by {@link #createServer()}.
825    *
826    * <p>
827    * Subclasses can override this method to customize server startup.
828    *
829    * @return The port that this server started on.
830    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
831    */
832   protected int startServer() throws Exception {
833      listener.onStartServer(this);
834      server.start();
835      out(messages, "ServerStarted", getPort());
836      listener.onPostStartServer(this);
837      return getPort();
838   }
839
840   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
841   // Utility methods
842   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
843
844   private static int findOpenPort(int[] ports) {
845      for (int port : ports) {
846         // If port is 0, try a random port between ports[0] and 32767.
847         if (port == 0)
848            port = new Random().nextInt(32767 - ports[0] + 1) + ports[0];
849         try (ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(port)) {
850            return port;
851         } catch (IOException e) {}
852      }
853      return 0;
854   }
855}
